author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
“Improve the basic amenities, which we have been asking for during the past many years, we will give vote”. This is what the predominant Dalit population in K.G.K. Nagar under Kangayam municipality would be telling the candidates who plan to approach them seeking votes in the coming Assembly elections.

Over 100 families are residing in the locality with the free house site pattas issued by the State Government more than two decades back.

Public toilets

“We will vote for the candidate who sounds sincere in looking into our demands like upgrading the earthen roads, setting up public toilets for women and children and construction of storm water drains, among a few other things”, L. Sivakumar, a resident, told The Hindu .

Elected representatives

S. Karuppaiah, State joint general secretary of Dalit Liberation Movement- Tamil Nadu, said the issues had already been taken to the notice of the district administration and elected representatives on many occasions without getting the grievances redressed.

“The families in the hamlet are residing in the houses constructed by the government and have ration cards, Aadhar cards, electors’ photo identity cards and electricity connection. It is pathetic that even for such a regularised colony, the basic facilities for the residents are far from satisfactory”, he said.
title: Dalits seek basic amenities
